00020 #include "Mutex.h"
00021 #include "JNIHelper.h"
00022 #include <cstdio>
00023 
00024 namespace com
00025 {
00026 namespace xuggle

00028 namespace ferry

00030 
00031 jclass Mutex :: mClass = 0;
00032 jmethodID Mutex :: mConstructorMethod = 0;
00033 
00034 bool Mutex :: mInitialized = false;
00035 
00036 Mutex :: Mutex()
00037 {
00038   mLock = 0;
00039   mSpinCount = 0;
00040 }
00041 
00042 Mutex :: ~Mutex()
00043 {
00044   JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00045   if (env)
00046   {
00047     if (mSpinCount > 0)
00048     {
00049       // OK, this is bad; someone left us in a bad
00050       // condition
00051       fprintf(stderr, "Destroying monitor %p with non-zero spin count\n",
00052           this);
00053       while (mSpinCount > 0)
00054       {
00055         this->unlock();
00056       }
00057     }
00058     if (mLock)
00059       env->DeleteGlobalRef(mLock);
00060   }
00061   mLock = 0;
00062 }
00063 
00064 bool
00065 Mutex :: init()
00066 {
00067   if (!mInitialized)
00068   {
00069     JNIHelper::sRegisterInitializationCallback(initJavaBindings, 0);
00070     mInitialized = true;
00071   }
00072   return mInitialized;
00073 }
00074 
00075 void
00076 Mutex :: initJavaBindings(JavaVM*, void*)
00077 {
00078   JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00079   if (env && !mClass)
00080   {
00081     // We're inside a JVM, let's get to work.
00082     jclass cls = env->FindClass("java/lang/Object");
00083     if (cls)
00084     {
00085       // and find all our methods
00086 
00087       mConstructorMethod = env->GetMethodID(cls, "<init>", "()V");
00088 
00089       // keep a reference around
00090       mClass = (jclass) env->NewWeakGlobalRef(cls);
00091     }
00092   }
00093 }
00094 
00095 void
00096 Mutex :: lock()
00097 {
00098   if (!mInitialized)
00099     Mutex::init();
00100 
00101   if (mLock)
00102   {
00103     JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00104     if (env)
00105     {
00106       //fprintf(stderr, " PRE-ENTER: %p\n", mLock);
00107       if (env->ExceptionCheck())
00108       {
00109         // have a pending java exception; don't try the lock
00110         throw std::runtime_error("pending java exception; not locking");
00111       }
00112       // testing that a thrown ERROR doesn't cause core-dumps
00113       // throw std::runtime_error("bad panda; no shoots for you");
00114       
00115       if (env->MonitorEnter(mLock) != JNI_OK)
00116       {
00117         fprintf(stderr, "Could not enter lock: %p\n", mLock);
00118         throw std::runtime_error("failed to enter monitor; not locking");
00119       }
00120       else
00121       {
00122         if (env->ExceptionCheck()) {
00123           env->MonitorExit(mLock);
00124           throw std::runtime_error("failed to enter monitor due to "
00125               "pending exception; not locking");
00126         } else {
00127           // we're in the lock now!
00128           ++mSpinCount;
00129         }
00130       }
00131       //fprintf(stderr, "POST-ENTER: %p\n", mLock);
00132     }
00133   }
00134 }
00135 
00136 void
00137 Mutex :: unlock()
00138 {
00139   if (!mInitialized)
00140     Mutex::init();
00141 
00142   if (mLock)
00143   {
00144     JNIEnv *env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00145     if (env)
00146     {
00147       //fprintf(stderr, "  PRE-EXIT: %p\n", mLock);
00148       if (mSpinCount <= 0)
00149       {
00150         // we called unlock without a matching successful lock;
00151         // we must fail.
00152         throw std::runtime_error("unlock attempt on unlocked mutex");
00153       }
00154       // reduce the spin count regardless of result while still under
00155       // the lock
00156       --mSpinCount;
00157       
00158       if (env->MonitorExit(mLock) != JNI_OK)
00159       {
00160         // this can fail in out of memory situations but there's not much
00161         // we can do.
00162         //fprintf(stderr, "Could not exit lock: %p\n", mLock);
00163         throw std::runtime_error("failed attempt to unlock mutex");
00164       }
00165       //fprintf(stderr, " POST-EXIT: %p\n", mLock);
00166     }
00167   }
00168 }
00169 
00170 Mutex*
00171 Mutex :: make()
00172 {
00173   Mutex* retval = 0;
00174   jobject newValue = 0;
00175   JNIEnv *env = 0;
00176 
00177   try
00178   {
00179     if (!mInitialized)
00180       Mutex::init();
00181 
00182     env = JNIHelper::sGetEnv();
00183     if (env)
00184     {
00185       if (!mClass)
00186       {
00187         // we're being called BEFORE our initialization
00188         // callback was called, but during someone
00189         // elses initialization route, so we can be
00190         // sure we have a JVM.
00191         Mutex::initJavaBindings(JNIHelper::sGetVM(), 0);
00192       }
00193       if (mClass && mConstructorMethod)
00194       {
00195         retval = new Mutex();
00196         if (!retval)
00197           throw std::bad_alloc();
00198         retval->acquire();
00199 
00200         if (env->ExceptionCheck())
00201           throw std::bad_alloc();
00202         
00203         // we're running within Java
00204         newValue = env->NewObject(mClass, mConstructorMethod);
00205         if (!newValue)
00206           throw std::bad_alloc();
00207         
00208         if (env->ExceptionCheck())
00209           throw std::bad_alloc();
00210         
00211         retval->mLock = env->NewGlobalRef(newValue);
00212         
00213         if (!retval->mLock)
00214           throw std::bad_alloc();
00215         
00216         if (env->ExceptionCheck())
00217           throw std::bad_alloc();
00218         env->DeleteLocalRef(newValue);
00219         newValue = 0;
00220       }
00221     }
00222   }
00223   catch (std::bad_alloc & e)
00224   {
00225     VS_REF_RELEASE(retval);
00226     throw e;
00227   }
00228   catch (std::exception &e)
00229   {
00230     fprintf(stderr, "got uncaught error creating mutex: %p", retval);
00231     VS_REF_RELEASE(retval);
00232   }
00233   if (env && newValue)
00234     env->DeleteLocalRef(newValue);
00235   return retval;
00236 }
00237 }
00238 }
00239 }
